{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3137614,"name":"Joseph ","username":"Chozenm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chozenm/{size}/184413_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T13:04:41.360Z","cooked":"

so i have this Drivetrain subsystem and i cant pass the code due to a error that apperes when i try to deploy my code
this is the code that is creating conflicts:
@Override
public void periodic() {
setDefaultCommand(new drivetrain());
}
when i take out this part of the subsystem i dont get any errors deploying but then i cant use it because it isnt getting called
﻿﻿﻿﻿
this is the whole error code :

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:358): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.

  • The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

  • The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.

  • See Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation for more information.

  • Error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:365): The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

You only need to set the default command once. Consider moving that call into the constructor of the subsystem, or some other place where it’s only called once. Right now, every loop of your code is setting the default command, as well as creating a new instance of your drivetrain command.

Have you read through the “Reading Stacktraces” link that you pasted as part of the output? There should be more to the message above the part that you copied. When asking for help, please make sure to include the entire output.

Also, please share your code as a link to github (or similar). You may think that line is the issue, but we can only trust that assumption without seeing the rest of the code.

setDefaultCommand() is a method of the class SubsystemBase.

You should be calling it on the existing instance of your Drivetrain, where ever it is you instantiate that.

Most of the time this should happen within the constructor of the RobotContainer.

Additionally, setDefaultCommand() takes a parameter of a Command not the subsystem.

So for example:

// RobotContainer.java
Drivetrain drivetrain = new Drivetrain(); // or however you instantiate your specific subsystem
public RobotContainer() {
drivetrain.setDefaultCommand(command); // "command" should be replaced with the instantiation of the command you created
}

You can read more about default commands here: Subsystems — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
